Title: Sanctum

USA release: 04/02/2011

Company: Earthship Productions (Universal Pictures)

Writer: Andrew Wight, John Garvin 
Starring: Richard Roxburgh, Ioan Gruffudd, Rhys Wakefield, Alice Parkinson, Dan Wyllie, Allison Cratchley, Christopher Baker, John Garvin, Sean Dennehy 
Rating: Not recommended for children under 7 years 


Synopsis: 
A team of divers underwater cave embarks on a dangerous expedition through the most extensive network of caves, beautiful and inaccessible of the world. When a tropical storm forces them to penetrate deep into caves, they must face the wild waters, the deadliest ground and the growing panic, trying to find a way out (which none of them know) that leads to the sea . 

The expert diver Frank McGuire (Richard Roxburgh) has spent months Esa'ala exploring caves in the South Pacific. However, when a flash flood cut them out, the core team of Frank, which includes his 17 year old son, Josh (Rhys Wakefield) and the financier Carl Hurley (Ioan Gruffudd) - is forced to drastically change plan. 

The team, which also included Carl's girlfriend, Victoria (Alice Parkinson), and Crazy George (Dan Wyllie) - see how its provisions are becoming increasingly scarce and will have no choice but to try to break through an underwater maze to try to find a way out. Not be long before having to face the inevitable question: Can they survive, or be trapped forever? 

Production notes: 
- Film based on true events that has executive produced by James Cameron.
